L2_gloss: Truncated form of letter 'a chung' (ཨ་ཆུང), the specific terma head mark (Unicode 0F01: ༁). The name of the sign in the Tibetan script is written thus: གཏེར་ཡིག་མགོ་ཨ་ཆུང.
A terma head mark (Unicode 0F02: ༂). In the Tibetan script the sign is known thus: གཏེར་ཡིག་མགོ་ཨུམ་རྣམ་བཅད་མ
The terma head mark (Unicode 0F03: ༃). The specific name of the sign is གཏེར་ཡིག་མགོ་ཨུམ་གཏེར་ཚེག་མ.
An honorific head mark which heralds the beginning of text or commencement of a new folio. In Tibetan it is called ཡིག་མགོ་མདུན་མ (yig mgo mdun ma).
A Tibetan mark (Unicode 0F05: ༅) that closes the head marks with which it ligates. The name for this sign in the Tibetan script is ཡིག་མགོ་སཅབ་མ (yig mgo sacb ma).
An ornamental translingual mark (Unicode 0F07: ༇), the ཡིག་མགོ་ཚེག་ཤད་མ.
